Yes, indeed, that's how to do it.

I'm wondering which build of heritrix yo=
u guys are using. Javascript
extraction is considerably tighter since
https=
://webarchive.jira.com/browse/HER-1523 was addressed. If you are using
a re=
cent build, I'd be curious to know about what kinds of patterns of bad
urls=
 you're seeing.

You can find recent builds at


http://builds.archive.org:=
8080/maven2/org/archive/heritrix/heritrix/3.1.2-SNAPSHOT/

Noah

On Tue, Ma=
r 19, 2013 at 5:16 AM, Coram, Roger <Roger.Coram@...> wrote:

>
>
>  Hi M=
atteo,****
>
> We ran into a similar problem and ended up disabling Javascr=
ipt extraction
> entirely:****
>
> **=B7         **Remove the *ExtractorJs*=
 bean in its entirety.****
>
> **=B7         **The *ExtractorHTML* has an *=
extractJavascript* property
> which you can set to =91false=92. ****
>
> **=
 **
>
> Thanks,****
>
> Roger****
>
> ** **
>
> *From:* archive-crawler@yah=
oogroups.com [mailto:

matteo.ceccarello@...

rawler@yahoogroups.com

 hops****
>
> ** **
>
>   ****
>
> Hi all
>
> we are performing a large cra=
wl with heritrix 3 and some hosts we are
> visiting complain about lots of =
404 errors that generate a lot of traffic
> on their sites. All these sites=
 have a similarity: they contain javascript
> code that contains strings lo=
oking as fragments of URLs.
>
> So I suspect that all these requests are ge=
nerated because of speculative
> links.
>
> Is there a way to tweak how "ag=
gressive" they are? I mean, is there a way
> to tell heritrix: "perform onl=
y the speculative hops you are reasonably
> sure about"?
>
> Or, in alterna=
tive, is there a way to completely disable speculative hops?
>
> Thank you =
very much
> Matteo****
>
> ****

*********************************

t www.bl.uk

<div dir=3D"ltr">Yes, indeed, that's how to do it.<br><br>I'm wonde=
ring which build of heritrix you guys are using. Javascript extraction is c=
onsiderably tighter since <a href=3D"https://webarchive.jira.com/browse/HER=
-1523">https://webarchive.jira.com/browse/HER-1523</a> was addressed. If yo=
u are using a recent build, I'd be curious to know about what kinds of =
patterns of bad urls you're seeing.<br>

ult"></div><br><a href=3D"http://builds.archive.org:8080/maven2/org/archive=

ass=3D"im"><p class=3D""><u></u>=A0<u></u></p><p class=3D"">=A0 <u></u><u><=
/u></p><div><div><div><p style=3D"margin-bottom:12pt">Hi all<br><br>we are =
performing a large crawl with heritrix 3 and some hosts we are visiting com=
plain about lots of 404 errors that generate a lot of traffic on their site=
s. All these sites have a similarity: they contain javascript code that con=
tains strings looking as fragments of URLs. <br>
<br>So I suspect that all =
these requests are generated because of speculative links.<br><br>Is there =
a way to tweak how "aggressive" they are? I mean, is there a way =
to tell heritrix: "perform only the speculative hops you are reasonabl=
y sure about"?<br>
<br>Or, in alternative, is there a way to completel=
y disable speculative hops?<br><br>Thank you very much<br>Matteo<u></u><u><=
/u></p></div><div><p class=3D""><span style=3D"color:white"><u></u><u></u><=
